articles.content:
Appeal of Swiss Organization Responded to by Peruvian Organization 
   Pyongyang, September 8 (KCNA) -- The Peruvian-Korean Institute of Culture and Friendship issued a resolution on Sept. 1 responding to an appeal of a Swiss organization to significantly commemorate the Day of the Sun and Feb. 16 in 2007 as common holidays of humankind.
 The resolution extended full support to the Swiss preparatory committee's decision to hold significant events including meeting, film show and book and photo exhibition on the occasions of the Day of the Sun, Feb. 16 and Dec. 24 in 2007 with a view to widely introducing the exploits performed by the three generals of Mt. Paektu.    
 The institute will significantly commemorate the birthdays of President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il in 2007 as common holidays of progressive mankind, the resolution noted, adding that it will encourage many Peruvians to visit the old home of Kim Jong Il in the secret camp of Mt. Paektu in February 2007.

Kim Jong Il Sends Wreath to Bier of Late Jon Hyong Gyu 
   Pyongyang, September 8 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il Thursday sent a wreath to the bier of the late Labor Hero and People's Announcer Jon Hyong Gyu, expressing deep condolences over his death.

articles.title: U.S. Underground Nuclear Test Denounced in S. Korea
Art Performance Given to Celebrate Birthday of DPRK
articles.content:
U.S. Underground Nuclear Test Denounced in S. Korea 
   Pyongyang, September 8 (KCNA) -- The South Headquarters of the National Alliance for the Country's Reunification (Pomminryon) in a statement titled "the U.S. nuclear test is an obvious criminal act of disturbing the global peace" on September 2 declared it would never tolerate any nuclear activities of the U.S., according to a press report.
 Accusing the U.S. of conducting another underground nuclear test in Nevada on August 30, the statement noted that it convinced the world people once again of the fact that the U.S. development of weapons of mass destruction has reached a dangerous phase.    
 All the U.S. nuclear activities are aimed at military invasion, the statement observed, stressing that the South Headquarters of Pomminryon denounces the recent U.S. nuclear test in Nevada and would strongly react to it.

articles.title: 7th National Program Contest of Students Held
articles.content:
Art Performance Given to Celebrate Birthday of DPRK 
   Pyongyang, September 8 (KCNA) -- The Workers' Art Squad of the C.C., the General Federation of Trade Unions of Korea gave a performance at the Central Workers' Hall on September 7 to mark the 58th founding anniversary of the DPRK.
 The curtain-raiser was the chorus "Song of the Proclamation of the People's Republic" at the colorful performance which included female vocal sextet "Let Fly the Flag of the Republic, Our Flag of Three Colors," dialogic poem "Undying Feats" and baritone solo "Tell Ye the Road for Songun Leadership."    
 The performers sang in high tone of the immortal feats performed by President Kim Il Sung in building a true socialist country of Juche on this land, where people are the masters of the country, and the sagacity of Kim Jong Il's leadership who is demonstrating the dignity and might of the DPRK to the world with his unique Songun policy.

DPRK Judoists Successful at 1st East Asia Judo Championships
   Pyongyang, September 8 (KCNA) -- DPRK Judoists gave good accounts of themselves at the 1st East Asia Judo Championships held in Ulaan Baatar on September 2 and 3.
 Pak Myong Hui finished a gold medalist by overwhelming all her adversaries in the women's half light, Hwang Chun Gum bagged a silver medal in the women's 57 kg category, Pak Ok Song and Ri Chol Ryong carried away bronze medals respectively in the women's 48 kg category and men's 60 kg category.

articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Terms Hostile Forces' Wild Ambition Day Dream
   Pyongyang, September 8 (KCNA) -- The U.S. is employing every conceivable means and method and resorting to dastardly moves to stifle the DPRK as evidenced by the fact that it is staging ceaseless exercises for igniting a new war by amassing sophisticated military hardware and armed forces in south Korea and in its vicinity and escalating its sanctions and blockade against the DPRK. But the wild ambition of the hostile forces is nothing but a day dream.
 Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, declared this in his report made at the national meeting held to celebrate the 58th birthday of the DPRK.    
 Our army and people will smash any political and military offensive, economic blockade and destabilizing moves of the U.S. imperialists and their followers and eternally glorify Korean socialism under the banner of the DPRK as they cast in their lot with their system and cause and have tremendous war deterrent for self-defence and the independent national economy.

articles.title: Floral Basket to Kim Jong Il from Family of Zhang Weihua
articles.content:
Greetings to President of Guyana
   Pyongyang, September 8 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Thursday sent a message of greetings to Bharrat Jagdeo upon his reelection as president of Guyana.
 Expressing the belief that the friendly relations between the two countries would favorably develop in mutual interests, the message sincerely wished the president success in his responsible work.

articles.title: Floral Basket to Kim Jong Il from Foreign Embassy Officials
articles.content:
Floral Basket to Kim Jong Il from Family of Zhang Weihua
   Pyongyang, September 8 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il was presented with a floral basket by the family of Zhang Weihua, an anti-Japanese revolutionary martyr, on the occasion of the 58th anniversary of the DPRK.
 Written on the ribbon were letters "We sincerely wish the great leader Comrade Kim Jong Il good health."

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Meets Congratulatory Group of Koreans in Japan
articles.content:
Floral Basket to Kim Jong Il from Foreign Embassy Officials
   Pyongyang, September 8 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il was presented with a floral basket by officials in charge of cultural and friendly relations of foreign embassies here on the occasion of the 58th founding anniversary of the DPRK.
 The floral basket was handed to an official concerned by Ioan Dedean, councilor of the Romanian embassy, on behalf of the foreign embassy officials on Friday.

articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets Congratulatory Group of Koreans in Japan
   Pyongyang, September 8 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, met and conversed with the congratulatory group of Koreans in Japan for celebrating the 58th anniversary of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea led by Ko Tok U, vice-chairman of the Central Standing Committee of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Friday in a compatriotic atmosphere.
